item.description:
Join the group for a fun, easy walk along the backroads and across the dam of this beautiful park.

After the walk we'll continue the fun by renting kayaks and enjoying paddling on the scenic lake.

 

 

Meet at the boat house at 8:45 am. We'll start the walk promptly at 9 am.

Please note that there is a $5 entrance fee to the park. 

Cost of this event is $20 per person and includes your kayak rental for one hour.

If you are skipping the walk and joining up with us for Kayaking, meet at the boathouse at 10 am.

Bring a picnic lunch and lawn chair to hang out after kayaking. There's a beach there too if you want to go swimming.

 

Directions From 495 (to Cedar Street/Route 85)

Take Route 495 to Exit 21A, Main Street, Hopkinton

Travel on Main Street until the third traffic light located at the heart of downtown Hopkinton. Turn left, traveling north on Route 85. Head approximately two miles on and the Hopkinton State Park entrance is on your right.

Once in the park, go through the contact station and make a right at the fork in the road. Follow the road until it turns down towards the water. The water is usually a great place to look for us and you'll know you're there when you see the boathouse.

From Route 9
Take Route 85 towards Hopkinton
Located on left a few miles down

 

More direction options: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/northeast/hpsp.htm
item.name: Walk & Kayak
